data.eng: to be pleasing to (close to gustar - podoba się)
to suit someone, to be convenient for (odpowiada)
to be painful, to hurt (sprawia ból)
to be enchanting to, to like very much (sprawia zachwyt)
to be lacking sth, to be missing sth (brakuje)
to fascinate, to be fascinating to (sprawia fascynację)
to be important to, to matter (jest istotne <komu>)
to seem, to appear to be (wydaje się)
to be left over, to remain (zostało)
to have more than enough of sth (wystarczy)
to charge for, to get paid (płacić)
to tell a story, to count (opowiedzieć, liczyć)
to count on, to rely on (ufać [dosłownie: liczyć na])
the window in a car, boat, or airplane
It is midday. / It is noon.
should, ought to, must (plus infinitive), to owe
to pass (by), to happen, to spend (time)
to take, to have (something to drink, breakfast, lunch, dinner)
to know (a fact), to know how
to leave, to exit, to go out
to turn, to fold, to bend
to be successful, to have success
to be in a rage, to be very angry
to be lucky, to have luck
to try to (do sth), to be about (sth)
to achieve, to succeed in (+ infinitive)
a little bit, a few, not much, not many
you’re welcome, think nothing of it
it’s not such a big deal
above, on top of, about (a theme or topic)
since; from (a point of departure in place or time)
before, in front of, in the presence of
in front of, opposite, facing, across from
with yourself, with himself, with herself, with themselves
